title: Let's Talk About Swain
body:
I made a post on the LoL subreddit (my main browsing grounds for LoL content) about Swain, and my reasoning behind giving him 100 extra autoattack range.  It didn't get much notice, but I think I raised some good points. Notably, there is a high precedent for Swain having a longer autoattack range simply because Anivia exists. Anivia is very similar to Swain: 

* niche picks (although Anivia is far more popular thanks to the likes of Froggen and skins actually being released for her), 
* similar winrates, 
* near identical build-archetypes, 
* near identical themes (immobile mages based in locking down opponents with intense single-target damage with minimal AoE damage to give teamfighting relevance). 

I argued that Swain's weak laning phase resultant from a lack of real waveclear (which is where Anivia far and away beats Swain back) could be balanced by giving him more attack range, allowing him to last hit safer, just as Anivia can. [The full post is here ](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3svdxc/give_swain_100_autoattack_range/)(I am unaware of restrictions linking to Reddit) if you want to give it a read.

I've played Swain for about 4 years. My winrate over 2015 Ranked (I finished at gold 3, having climbed to gold 1) was 74% over 54 games (my friend tells me this is good). I love Swain as a champion, from his badass lore to the way his immobile kit epitomises the checks and balance of video game balance.  He is very strong when fighting within his ranges, but his immobility and lack of waveclear give an enemy clear counterplay to  an enemy (a feature Riot's more recent champions seen to do away with). He was the third champion I played since starting LoL.

Which is why, with this history, the 5.24 patch changes honestly outraged me. The justification for Swain's W nerf is that Corrupting Potion and Deathfire Torch Keystone are too oppressive on Swain. Let me address this reasoning by saying that Corrupting Potion is horrid on Swain. It gives shit-all mana (which, due to Swain's crazy high basic spell costs and, of course, his exponentially greater ult mana cost, is a massive con). Secondly, Doran's Ring plus Swain's passive barely gives him the mana he needs to sustain trading in-lane. Deathfire Torch is, in my honest opinion, meh on Swain. The damage it gives is subpar, and, not only that, the ferocity tree isn't as good as the cunning tree is for Swain. Cunning gives flat mr and armour pen (vital for early game trading, and late game ADC shredding), the ever-crazy Thunderlord's Keystone, mana regen, cookies, *easier last hitting*. It's just too good for Swain to miss out on. 

With this in mind, let me restate Riot's reasoning for Swain's nerf. Swain was too oppressive against the players who a) didn't counterpick him with one of his many hard/medium counters or b) doesn't know how Swain works, so just feeds to him like a first timer playing against Riven. The reason he is oppressive to these players is because of the Deathfire Torch mastery, *which we are also nerfing this patch* in a classic example of Riot's circle of balance (buff item, champion strong, nerf champion to compensate, later nerf item, champion incredibly weak). 

You might be wondering why I think the nerf is so bad. The reason is this: Swain should only ever max W last. It's a decent CC ability, but compared to not only Anivia's AoE stun, but to the CC more recent champions boast (Yasuo's AoE spammable knockups come to mind, and he isn't even that recent), it's pitiful. Landing a W was hard enough, but for it to only last a single second just adds salt to the wound. If you're playing against any sort of competent player they will either be dashing in and around you as Swain (eg Yasou) or they will be staying as far away with you, clearing with spells and the occasional auto. In both instances actually landing a W is near impossible; for it to not even be useful when you finally land it is just plain wrong. 

I'm making this incredibly long-winded, hopefully justified post because I truly believe Swain requires compensation. 

* His kit is low mobility and now barely locks down a target long enough to kill without being fed. 
* He is squishy even with ult and RoA, and, even with the sustain of his ult, is easily bursted by near any assassin or mage under the sun. 
* The new penetration item which gives grievous wounds *on-hit* for, I believe, 4 seconds, wrecks any hope Swain has for sustaining through a fight. 
* The colossal Zhonyas nerf a few patches ago, making it weaker and cost more, is a huge hit to Swain, a champ who only synergises better with RoA.  
* Swain is butchered by range, and had to burn flash to 1v1 an adc even before they were all buffed. That near every adc is stronger, has access to items which shred Swain's HP or healing and outrange him even more puts Swain into the ground even more
* He is one of the few, if not only champion in the game (outside of maybe Urgot and 1 or 2 supports) who retains the identify of tanky carry, whilst being ranged. As such he gets many of the deficits of being near-melee range (juggernaut-esque immobility), with many of the deficits of being ranged (no mr per level)

I honestly don't know what difference this post would make. Ideally it would result in someone at Riot looking at my justifications, and either reverting the nerf, or giving him bonuses in other areas. My suggested buffs would be any of the following:

* the AA range buff to 600 units
* a movement speed buff, which is increased when in Bird form, a la Quinn's new ult (but obviously not so brokenly fast as that!)
* a better method of clearing. Either buffing his ult's damage against minions, or letting it shoot 6 birds, or doubling its rate of fire. Anything to let him have even half the waveclear Anivia gets upon reaching level 6. 
* a rework into a melee champion. Now he hits things with his cane! Crits are his bird biting the enemy! His abilities are slightly reduced in range, but their damage is buffed, mana and cd are reduced, and his ult mana cost no longer scales over used time. I only just considered this, but I honestly am beginning to really like it as a concept. 

This is a really long and rambly post, and I'd give a TL:DR but I don't want to type another thousand words. If you did give it a read, thank you for doing so! Give your thoughts below, I'd love to see this post (and my favourite cripple) get some love and much-needed attention.

Sources:

* [The Fighter Class](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Category:Fighter_champion)
* [The Legend](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Swain)
* [Swain's Stats](http://champion.gg/champion/swain)

Hey thur, Swain main here myself! Played around ~500 games with Swain in ranked across s3-s5 and have had similar winrates, which is actually pretty cool to see another Swain doing pretty good. I only just read the patch notes and _good god_ does that sound stupid. 

Nevermove was already hard enough to hit as it was given that:

a) Nevermove has a cast time, delay, and distinct audio to tell you to move; and
b) You're extremely susceptible to all kinds of hard cc whilst moving in to set beatrice onto a (keyword) rooted target should W hit (I've been hit by at least a few hundred Ahri charms trying to follow up after nevermove). 

Two seconds isn't even that long given that it's a **_DELAYED ROOT_** as opposed to a stun.  If they're looking at ranked win % as a justification for the nerf, he's not even above 50% in the source you've cited above, which is crazy. He's not being used competitively at the moment with the control mage and early jungle meta (combined with broken top laners), so I'm wondering why they've decided to do this...

"When Swain’s good, his dominance over the lane borders on abusive - and Swain’s pretty good right now" (Patch 5.24 Notes, 2015). I don't feel like the mastery rework favors Swain more than any other solo laner, and this nerf is just _too_ harsh. For a skill that only gets some love after torment and decrepify when the game's already in it's mid to late stages, a _FIFTY PERCENT REDUCTION IN THE CC DURATION AT RANK ONE WHERE IT STAYS FOR THE MAJORITY OF THE GAME_ is just too much.

We've undoubtedly played more Swain than the goose who's plucked this ridiculous nerf out of the basket of bad ideas at Rito HQ, and despite the fact we don't have access to the microdata they do, I, too, feel like it's too much.

You've killed my three-year love for Swain in the past five minutes, but I'm glad to see I'm not the only one who finds it stupid.
